overview_of_class: This course will introduce students to Joyce's short stories in Dubliners and then move to an immersive engagement with Ulysses, a work that cries out to be performed and benefits enormously by being discussed, workshopped, and read aloud in class. It is a tour do force in any terms, influencing numerous writers and it is especially rich as a source of material for actors and directors. There will be two rounds of solo or group performances, short quizzes, two papers, a mid-term (l hr) and a final performance, solo or group. The Final performances constitute the final examination. Background information about IrIreland's history and Homer's The Odyssey ?will be woven into the course. Many students across many years attest to the powerful influence of this course on their reading and performing. And, the course is challenging and fun!
name: Studies in James Joyce
subject: PERF_ST
